wikipedia_page.main: Richard "Dick" Bullock (20 August 1847 –7 February 1920) was a Cornishman who once sang in a Methodist choir and later became a legendary figure of the Wild West Cowboy era. His quick-shooting deeds working on the Deadwood stage gained him the nickname "Deadwood Dick".

response: *Richard Bullock (1847–1921), gunman. A legendary figure of the Wild West Cowboy era,  his quick-shooting deeds working on the Deadwood stage gained him the nickname "Deadwood Dick".
* Cornishman Richard Bullock, gunman and bullion guard on the Deadwood Stage (1847–1921).
